Package abyss.plugin.api.entities

Class Player

java.lang.Object
abyss.plugin.api.entities.Entity
abyss.plugin.api.entities.PathingEntity
abyss.plugin.api.entities.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Identifiable, Locatable
public final class Player extends PathingEntity
A snapshot of a player within the game world. This data is constant, and will not be changed after this object is created.

  • Nested Class Summary

    • isReachable

      public boolean isReachable()
      Specified by:
      isReachable in class PathingEntity

    • isUnderAttack

      public boolean isUnderAttack()
      Determines if this player is under attack currently. This only works for the local player and should be considered for revision.
      Returns:
      If this player is under attack currently.

    • getWornItems

      public Map<EquipmentSlot,Item> getWornItems()
      Retrieves all visible worn items that this player is wearing. Not all equipment is visible to remote players (e.g. ring slot.)
      Returns:
      All worn items that this player is wearing.

    • getWornItem

      public Item getWornItem(EquipmentSlot slot)
      Gets the visible worn item that this player is wearing in the specified slot
      Parameters:
      slot - the slot to check for a visible worn item
      Returns:
      the worn item, otherwise null

    • getTotalLevel

      public int getTotalLevel()
      Retrieves the total level of this player. This may only be valid if their total level is displayed.
      Returns:
      The total level of this player, if accessible.

    • getCombatLevel

      public int getCombatLevel()
      Retrieves the combat level of this player. This may only be valid if their combat level is displayed.
      Returns:
      The combat level of this player, if accessible.

    • getHealth

      public float getHealth()
      Retrieves this player's health percentage (0-1), if they are currently in combat. The status bar must be displayed above the player's head to retrieve their health. If you need the local player's health, you can use the more reliable Client.getCurrentHealth()
      Returns:
      This player's health percentage, or -1 if not in combat.

    • getAdrenaline

      public float getAdrenaline()
      Retrieves this player's adrenaline fill percentage (0-1), if currently available.
      Returns:
      This player's adrenaline fill percentage, or -1 if not available.
